data.title: Get Current Census Data for Joplin, MO
data.meta_description: Need Joplin demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Joplin, MO from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 53,095 people, Joplin is the 12th most populated city in the state of Missouri out of 1,064 cities. But watch out, Joplin, because Florissant with 51,128 people and Chesterfield with 49,166 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Joplin racial/ethnic groups are White (82.4%) followed by Hispanic (7.2%) and Two or More (4.6%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Joplin households was $50,996. Joplin households made slightly more than Vinita Park households ($50,964), Watson households ($50,938), and Vandiver households ($50,938) . However, 12.0% of Joplin families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Joplin residents is 36.4 years young.
